titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Coll. 390 Item 281: Kāśīprakaraṇa

availability.licence: These images and the content of Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts Ms. Coll. 390 Item 281: Kāśīprakaraṇa are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. notesStmt.note: 146 leaves foliated 1-76, 78-147, upper left and lower right verso.
Dated saṃvat 1914 (1857) (f. 147v); literally written as 19 104 78, but is likely 1914 as determined from Ms. Coll. 390, Item 280, its companion manuscript.

Mistakes covered over in yellow or blacked out; some corrections and additions in margins; significant syllables, words, or phrases highlighted in red throughout. Some folios treated with yellow turmeric powder.
Belonged to a single manuscript along with Ms. Coll 390, Item 278, Item 279, and Item 280.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Manuscript is a compendium and guide used for consultation by those wanting to learn the benefits (such as liberation at death) of visiting the pilgrimage center of Kāśī, and the rules and regulations (Hindu law, Dharma) that govern such visits. Text is part of a larger work called the "Bridge to the three holy cities" (Tristhalīsetu), which deals with three major pilgrimage centers in India: Kāśī (Varāṇasī), Prayāga (Allahabad), and Gayā.

msItem.title: Kāśīprakaraṇa
काशीप्रकरण
msItem.colophon: Colophon: iti śrīmadvidvanmukuṭamāṇikyādākṣiṇātmālaṃkāraśrīmadbhaṭṭarāmeśvarasūnunārāyaṇābhaṭṭaviracite tristhalīsetau kāśīprakaraṇe tanmaraṇānmuktivicāraḥ samāptaḥ // samāptaṃ kāśīprakaraṇaṃ ataḥ paraṃgayāprakaraṇaṃ bhaviṣyati // śubham astu saṃvat 19 104 78 caitrakṛṣṇacaturthyāmṃ caṃdravāserelīkhītaṃ samāptaṃ śrīgaṃgādevyai namaḥ (f. 147v).
